name: Shop
author: RiceKirby
summary: You know what everyone loves? Money. So, why not save your money to buy items and defeat the other social classes? That's exactly what you do here: Hard Workers, Thieves and Rich People can get Coins by different ways to buy items like Guns, Dress or Shields and gain abilities to beat the other sides!

sides.winmsg: ±Shop Owner: 'I love those Rich People, like ~Players~, because they always spend a lot of money on my shop!'
±Shop Owner: 'Damn those Thieves! ~Players~ always steal me and get away with it!'
±Shop Owner: 'I am a Hard Worker myself, so I can sympathize with people like ~Players~, who win only with honest methods!'
±Shop Owner: 'Since everyone died, this Philanthropist named ~Players~ has decided to donate all of their money to me :D'

roles.startupmsg: You are a ~Role~!
roles.help: You have your own company, which gives you 3 Coins every night. You can buy items which give you limited access to other actions (type /gun to buy a Gun, /shield to buy a Shield, etc).
roles.help2: You have 25 coins. Items you can buy: Sword (daykill, 9 coins), Badge (extra vote, 6 coins), Speaker (expose, 4 coins), Gun (nightkill, 5 coins), Drug (poison, 3 coins), Lens (inspect, 3 coins), Dress (distract, 2 coins), Shield (protect, 1 coin).

convertVoters.message: After lynching ~Self~, some people picked some of their Coins!

roles.help2: You have 4 coins. Items you can buy: Sword (daykill, 9 coins), Badge (extra vote, 6 coins), Gun (nightkill, 5 coins), Lens (inspect, 3 coins), Dress (distract, 2 coins), Shield (protect, 1 coin).

convertVoters.message: After lynching ~Self~, some people picked some of their Coins!

roles.help2: You have 2 coins. Items you can buy: Sword (daykill, 9 coins), Badge (extra vote, 6 coins), Gun (nightkill, 5 coins), Lens (inspect, 3 coins), Dress (distract, 2 coins), Shield (protect, 1 coin).

convertVoters.message: After lynching ~Self~, some people picked some of their Coins!

If lynched, the first and last person to vote you will gain 5 coins each, so be careful with greedy players in case you are revealed! You believe all sides are victims of this harsh capitalist system, so you are helping them all and therefore can win with anyone.

You are into charity, so you can give 1 item to another player every night with /gun, /lens, /dress or /shield. You can also give 1 coin to another player with /donate [name]. If lynched, the first person to vote you will gain 3 coins, so be careful with greedy players in case you are revealed! You believe all sides are victims of this harsh capitalist system, so you are helping them all and therefore can win with anyone.

roles.info: Starts with more money and has a higher cap. Has more items available to buy. Automatically gains 3 Coins every night. ~Sided~

roles.help: Dummy role for /roles and /sides
roles.info: Can steal up to 3 Coins from another player every night. ~Sided~

roles.help: Dummy role for /roles and /sides
roles.info: Can work during the night to gain 4 Coins (10% chance of gaining 5 Coins). ~Sided~

killmsg: ±Shop Owner: I heard that a ~Role~ named ~Player~ died recently! And they had no life insurance!
killusermsg: *** Oh, you died. And to make things worse, your family is now fighting over the inheritance!
lynchmsg: ±Shop Owner: I heard that a ~Role~ named ~Player~ didn't pay ~Count~ invoice(s) and got lynched! And they had no life insurance!
drawmsg: ±Shop Owner: Wait, where did everyone go? If everyone dies like this, I will go out of business!

changelog.25.05.2015: Fixed bug where Thief would not receive any coin when stealing from Philanthropist.
changelog.03.04.2015: New feature: when someone (except Philanthropist) is lynched, their coins will be distributed to the OPPONENT players that voted them (1 coin per voter). Philanthropist can now target itself to trick people into thinking they are not Philanthropist. Badge's prince increased from 5 to 6 coins.
changelog.06.12.2014: Thieves now gain 3 coins when stealing from the Philanthropist. Fixed bug were Thieves would be unable to use most actions in a turn they stole someone and gained an item from the Philanthropist.
changelog.23.11.2014: Poison is now faster than kills.
changelog.22.11.2014: Added a Philanthropist for small games (give less items/coins). Chance for /work giving 5 coins reduced from 15 to 10%. All items will always appear on /myrole info now.
changelog.13.10.2014: Thieves now start with 1 more coin on small games (since Workers can gain more coins per turn).
changelog.21.09.2014: Fixed /expose message not revealing target's side properly. Changed some prices and coins gained per turn for all roles. Tweaked initial money (Only rich people can buy swords N1 without Philanthropist's help now).
changelog.19.09.2014: Priority for Buy/Donate items changed (now it comes after work/steal so you can use coins at the night you gain them). Commands to buy items are not affected by distract. /work and /steal will not throw an 'Invalid Command' error when you are full of coins anymore. Number of coins and items that can be bought are displayed to the player every night.

tips.Prices: Sword (9 coins), Badge (6 coins), Speaker (4 coins), Gun (5 coins), Drug (3 coins), Lens (3 coins), Dress (2 coins), Shield (1 coins).
tips.Vote Power: Different from other items, buying a Badge will give you a permanent extra vote, but you can't buy more than 2 Badges per game.
tips.Lynch: When someone is lynched, their coins are distributed to the opponent players that voted them (teammate will not receive their coins). Only 1 coin per voter though.
tips.Double: You can buy 2 of a same item in the same turn by using /command2 (example: /gun and /gun2 to buy 2 Guns).
tips.Cancel: If you already typed the command to buy an item but changed your mind, you can use /cancel to clear all the 'buy' commands used at that night.
tips.Cap: Hard Workers and Thieves can have at most 15 Coins, while Rich People can get up to 25.
tips.Order: If you don't have enough Coins to buy all the items you selected, you will buy the more expensive ones first, and then whatever you still can pay for.
tips.Credit: Even if you don't have enough coins, you can always use any command to buy items in the hopes you will get enough coins during the night.
tips.Philanthropist: You can use your commands on yourself so people won't notice you are the Philanthropist (they will have no effect though).
tips.Daykills: Someone buying swords N1 is likely a Rich Person.
